Class DAOcustomers

java.lang.Object
DBDatabase.DAOcustomers
public abstract class DAOcustomers extends Object
this class connects to JDBC and access the 'appointments' table

    • getDataCustomer

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Customer> getDataCustomer() throws SQLException
      this method makes a connection to db, creates an observable list for customers, will get all customers from the table, then will return the table
      Returns:
      list This will return a list of customers to the customerController and will be displayed for the user to see
      Throws:
      SQLException - this is the sql exception

    • insert

      public static int insert(String customerName, String customerAddress, String postalCode, String customerPhone, Integer divisionID) throws SQLException
      this method will get data entered by the user and insert it into the customer table
      Parameters:
      customerName - this is the customer's name
      customerAddress - this is the customer's address
      postalCode - this is the customer's postal code
      customerPhone - this is the customer's phone number
      divisionID - this is the division identification number that represents the division the customer resides in.
      Returns:
      rowsaffected this will return the rows that were affected
      Throws:
      SQLException - this is the sql exception

    • update

      public static void update(Integer customerID, String customerName, String customerAddress, String postalCode, String customerPhone, Country country, Integer divisionID) throws SQLException
      this method will update an appointment after the user selects an customer row from the customerController
      Parameters:
      customerName - this is the customer's name
      customerAddress - this is the customer's address
      postalCode - this is the customer's postal code
      customerPhone - this is the customer's phone number
      country - this is the country where the customer resides in
      divisionID - this is the division identification number that represents the division the customer resides in.
      customerID - this is the customer's identification number
      Throws:
      SQLException - this is the sql exception
